summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/12/08 Average Rating: 3.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Brad Hall'], 'Starring': ['Eric Elmosnino', 'Matthew Fahey', 'Rachael Harris'], 'Studio': ['Cinedigm']} Review Text: Quirky. Smart. In your face law of attraction. They say: Think, feeeel, daydream, act as if and it will be true. Julia Louis-Dreyfus does exactly that as Ellen, a soon to be empty-nester fantasizing, living life large in her imagined romantic, enriched, joy de vivre in Paris.

The night before they are to catch their flight, her husband takes a different exit and Ellen has a head-on collision with her dream. She goes to Paris anyway, but finds it void, flat, and unpoetic. She trudges day to day anyway, waiting for the tightly closed vision to bloom.

Finally a facebook message with great news! She will cook dinner; find the finest ingredients in Paris; select the perfect wine; and she’ll buy the scarf with the way-too-high price-tag to accessorize the completely romantic evening that has just come into town. You can smell the cooking. Taste the wine. Feel the warmth of the candles. Ellen looks stunning and her soul is radiating. Then. He. Is. Late. And he is later. And later. He finally shows.

The next morning, with bile still in her throat, she settles into the patio café seat that virtually has her name on it from the days she has spent there waiting for the helium to inflate her gay Paris. The waiter who has watched her become a fixture throws her a bone and tells her of his favorite place in the city. The city floats again, just a little, enough to give hope. At last, there is romance in Paris.

This is where you might want to brace yourself for a turn that is nothing compared to the exit her husband took the night before the flight. Turns out there is the perfect Pâté. Life is about passion, and joy de vivre is about surfing whatever comes with lightheartedness, vivaciousness, and confidence. Ellen has found her joy and, well, law of attraction has come through after all. Review Title: The perfect Pâté: This movie will develop its fullest flavor after a few days of chilling Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/01/31 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', 'Українська', 'Tiếng Việt', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Paul Weitz', 'Adam Brooks', 'Jason Schwartzman', 'Roman Coppola', 'Tricia Brock'], 'Producers': ['Paul Weitz', 'Roman Coppola', 'Jason Schwartzman', 'Alex Timbers'], 'Starring': ['Lola Kirke', 'Saffron Burrows', 'Bernadette Peters'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: Good entertainment Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/03/09 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Richard Starzak', 'Christopher Sadler', 'Jay Grace', 'Lee Wilton', 'Seamus Malone', 'Jean-Philippe Vine', 'Richard Webber', 'Will Becher', 'Mike Mort', 'Dave Osmand'], 'Starring': ['John Sparkes', 'Justin Fletcher', 'Kate Harbour'], 'Studio': ['Aardman Animations']} Review Text: Clever, fun, perfect length for pure enjoyment! Kretchmer', 'Nick Marck', 'Michael Fields', 'Harry Winer', 'Jason Bloom', 'Steve Gomer', 'Guy Norman Bee', 'Marcos Siega', 'Sarah Pia Anderson', 'Mark Piznarski'], 'Producers': ['Not Specified'], 'Starring': ['Kristen Bell', 'Kristen Bell', 'Percy Daggs Iii'], 'Studio': ['The CW']} Review Text: Consistent writing...clever. not too much violence or sex. Review Title: Still liking veronica mars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/06/17 Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Woody Allen'], 'Producers': ['Letty Aronson', 'Stephen Tenenbaum', 'Edward Walson'], 'Starring': ['Eileen Atkins', 'Colin Firth', 'Marcia Gay Harden']} Review Text: Nice fun.good twist. Review Title: Good twist on the houdini story Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Booze Traveler Review Date: 2016/06/29 Categories: Unscripted Product Description: ["Host Jack Maxwell seeks the world's most interesting drinks and people."] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['B.J. Golnick', 'Clint Lealos'], 'Producers': ['Maria Bukhonina', 'Bryce Brentlinger', 'Emre Sahin', 'Kelly McPherson', 'Deborah Von Brod', 'Heather J. Miller', 'Jason Hamidi', 'Emily Abrahams']} Review Text: Entertaining. Learn interesting cultural and sociological facts. Review Title: Fun and informative Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/07/11 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Julian Jarrold'], 'Producers': ['Suzanne Mackie', 'Nick Barton', 'Peter Ettedgui', 'Mairi Brett'], 'Starring': ['Joel Edgerton', 'Chiwetel Ejiofor', 'Sarah-Jane Potts'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures Corp.']} Review Text: Two worlds collided and effectively created a wonderful new reality Review Title: Now thats how a niche market is served best Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/09/19 Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Chris Deleo'], 'Producers': ['Chris Deleo'], 'Starring': ['Enrique Enriquez'], 'Studio': ['Filmworks Entertainment']} Review Text: Loved how Enrique correlated tarot to poetry and art. If you can see the poetry and artistic motifs in any given city, you can read tarot. Fascinating. Review Title: Art, poetry, tarot... i never thought it before, but see it now Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/10/21 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Lisa Niemi'], 'Producers': ['Lisa Niemi', 'Sheralyn Austin-Gagne', 'Rhonda Baker', 'Kevin DeWalt', 'Teresa Garber', 'Phyllis Laing', 'Roma Roth', 'Patrick Swayze'], 'Starring': ['Patrick Swayze', 'Lisa Niemi', 'Timothy Webber'], 'Studio': ['Screen Media']} Review Text: The story line in and of itself pulled me in, while the choreography and dance made it an amazing journey. I have seen quite a few live performances of all kinds of dance, this was one of the best displays of emotion, healing, and vitality. I was transported and will watch this again. Review Title: Dance has never shown so much vitality Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/10/30 Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Evan Hart'], 'Producers': ['David DiVona', 'Marc Rosenbush', 'Nicholas D. Walsch'], 'Starring': ['Neale Donald Walsch'], 'Studio': ['Proven Entertainment']} Review Text: Real issues, real insights are concisely discussed. Whether it takes one or two episodes, viewers watch as a participant and Neale unpack and resolve the blocks that are keeping people stuck. The issues are relatable and the solutions are often a simple change in perspective obtainable and adaptable by anyone. A worthwhile series divided up in easily consumed segments. Compliments to Neale and his team--a meaningful job well done! Review Title: Real insights for real scenarios Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
**Summary of Preferences and Patterns:**

- **Genre Preference**: Shows a strong affinity for clever, fun, and quirky narratives that blend humor with life lessons and deeper insights.
- **Content Type**: Enjoys a mix of scripted and unscripted entertainment, including films, series, and cultural explorations. 
- **Quality Ratings**: Consistently rates products highly, often citing enjoyment, relatability, and meaningful storytelling as key factors.
- **Themes**: Appreciates stories that revolve around personal growth, culinary experiences, and romantic escapades, especially in vibrant settings like Paris.
- **Cultural Interest**: Shows interest in international perspectives, evident in a connection to cultural and sociological themes, such as through food and drink.
- **Artistic Appreciation**: Values artistic expressions, whether through dance, poetry, or visual storytelling, enhancing emotional experiences.
- **Engagement**: Engages deeply with content that encourages reflection, learning, and real-life applications.
- **Content Advisory Preferences**: Tends to select content with moderate advisory tags; enjoys narratives with complexity but avoids excessive violence.
- **Style**: Prefers straightforward storytelling paired with clever writing and humor, indicating a taste for both entertainment and thoughtful narrative arcs. 

Overall, the individual's purchasing history paints a picture of a discerning viewer who seeks joy, depth, and cultural richness in their entertainment choices.

target_interaction.title: A great personification of the inner child!
target_interaction.text: It was a nice portrayal of how our 'inner child' can get us back on track if we are willing to pay attention. Remembering our core essence is so important when life gets heavy, and problems that seemed insurmountable can seem to dissolve right before our eyes. The movie did a great job capturing the ideas of yielding to this knowing part of yourself and allowing it to guide and comfort you. Enjoy!
